sense.name: drink alcohol
sense.commentary: Note: implies a person consuming via their mouth
sense.examples: We imbibed frozen margaritas at an outdoor cafe in Taos. Having imbibed too freely at the wedding, Bob's uncle passed out on the floor.

sense.name: absorb fluid, heat or gas by an object
sense.commentary: Note: implies an object or body absorbing through some structure
sense.examples: The plant can imbibe the nutrients through the surface of its leaves. This sponge can imbibe a lot of water through its porous structure.

sense.name: accepting an idea
sense.commentary: Note: implies mental activity of a sentient being
sense.examples: They mused over the Marxist sentiments they had imbibed in their youth. This course is intended to imbibe principles of ethics into the minds of the MBA students.
